abstract_summ: Though there has been no significant rise in referrals to secondary mental health services to date (4 May 2020), a rapid surge in mental health presentations is widely anticipated.In comparison to other countries, New Zealand has had a very low number of confirmed and probable cases as well as COVID-19-related deaths.Telehealth may prove to be an efficient and cost-effective tool for the provision of future health services.However, the presence of porous borders, the double burden of communicable and non-communicable diseases, poverty, poor health literacy, infodemic and family clustering, and most of all, weak health systems, may make containment challenging.The mysterious nature of COVID-19 has caused tremendous stress and uncertainty leading to universal conflict between public health and state economy.
title_summ: Resilient and Agile Engineering Solutions to Address Societal Challenges such as Coronavirus PandemicOngoing Challenges Faced in the Global Control of COVID-19 PandemicLet us unite against COVID-19 – a New Zealand perspectiveSustained research fund and dedicated research center for preparing next pandemicCurrent efforts and challenges facing responses to 2019-nCoV in AfricaCOVID-19 pandemic: Emerging perspectives and future trends
title_abstract_phrases: Sustained research fund and dedicated research center for preparing next pandemicThe current COVID-19 pandemic caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus is imposing a great threat to human lives and international panic that is not seen since WWII, resulting in financial crisis, daily life disturbance, transportation shutdown, industry disruption, and countries/cities lockdown in every corner of the globe.Overall, this paper attempts to identify key areas where manufacturing can be employed to address societal challenges such as COVID-19.Ongoing Challenges Faced in the Global Control of COVID-19 PandemicAbstract The recent pandemic caused by SARS-CoV-2 has now spread worldwide and caused more than 51,000 deaths, by April 2nd 2020.Though there has been no significant rise in referrals to secondary mental health services to date (4 May 2020), a rapid surge in mental health presentations is widely anticipated.The mysterious nature of COVID-19 has caused tremendous stress and uncertainty leading to universal conflict between public health and state economy.In comparison to other countries, New Zealand has had a very low number of confirmed and probable cases as well as COVID-19-related deaths.
